comments:
I used to see this problem in M5a as well, but now (M6) Eclipse doesn't open the
file a more gracefully.  (see below)

There is nothing to specific that I can tell about my JSP.  I am using two
beans.  It used to work when I had one, but if I remove the second bean, it
still has the problem.  Other jsp pages open fine, so I am not sure of what is
wrong.  The JSP compiles fine externally (using ant), so I don't think there is
a syntax error causing a crash.  



Below is the info that Eclipse tells me.

problem with the file you are trying to edit. First close this error message and
then use "Open With..." to open the file in a different editor. Reason for the
failure: Assertion failed:

Restarting Eclipse makes the issue go away...but I think it should still be
looked at.

This looks similar to bug 87017

Were you using a recent WTP build?  In bug 87017 the problem only seemed to 
happen to some jsps and it wasnt obvious what the connection was.  But it 
seemed to be reproducible if you try to open/close the file repeatedly till 
you get the assertion error.  If this case is the same with you, could you 
attach your jsp?

Unfortunately, I cannot attach my source.  I am using the latest WTP milestone
release.  

I can't seem to reproduce it either.  It seems to happen most often though when
am cut&pasting quickly in a small area (like on one line).  

Hope this helps a little.
Changed Version field given new release numbering.

I can not reproduce on latest builds (and I did see on previous milestones). 
If anyone still sees this, especially with a reproducable test case), 
plesae re-open and we will track down remaining problems.
I haven't seen the issue in the M5 build.

This is part of a mass update to close out all stale WTP defects already verified by the reporter but awaiting closure by the assignee.  If you feel this defect was closed inappropriately, please reopen.

Thanks, John Lanuti
